metadata.title: CVE-2021-38491 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Mixed-content checks were unable to analyze opaque origins which led tosome mixed content being loaded. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 92.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38491` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 92.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 92.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 92.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '92.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
